I've posted a similar question on the Struts list, but maybe its more
appropriate for this list.

I'm trying to determine the best way to test my Struts Actions. I've
come across 2 projects that look interested.

1. StrutsTestCase (http://strutstestcase.sourceforge.net/)
and
2. Mockrunner (http://mockrunner.sourceforge.net/)

I like the simplicity of StrutsTestCase. I'm using a delegate in my
Action case, and would like to use a MockObject in place of the delegate
class. This way I could simulate exceptions, etc...

Unfortunately, I have been unable to devise a method to tell my Action
object what delegate class I'd like to use. 

One idea would be to put the delegate class in the request parameter.
This would be easy to do in StrutsTestCase, but I'm not sure how this
would work in a Live system. How would I get the delegate class into the
request?

Any other suggestions?

-- 
Bryce Fischer <bryce@...>
